lead_paragraph: Members of the Bush and Christie campaigns have communicated about their shared desire to halt Marco Rubio’s rise in the polls, Republican operatives say.

byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan and Steve Eder contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and JONATHAN MARTIN

headline.print_headline: Christie and Bush Double-Teaming a Rising Rubio
headline.main: Chris Christie and Jeb Bush Team Up on a Mutual Target: Marco Rubio

snippet: Members of the Bush and Christie campaigns have communicated about their shared desire to halt Marco Rubio’s rise in the polls, Republican operatives say.
abstract: Gov Chris Christie and Jeb Bush have begun criticizing Sen Marco Rubio more heavily in advance of New Hampshire primary,  and praising each other in public; alliance was prompted by Rubio's strong finish in Iowa caucuses, and view held by Christie and Bush that Rubio's rise presents greatest threat to future of both their campaigns.
